x-backref.description: Add a back reference to a relationship.

x-uselist.description: Turn a many to one into a one to one relationship.

x-secondary.description: Turn a one to many into a many to many relationship. The value of x-secondary is used as the name of the association table.

x-primary-key.description: Make a column a primary key.

x-autoincrement.description: Make an integer primary key column auto increment.

x-composite-index.description: Add composite index to a table.

x-unique.description: Add unique constraint to a column.

x-composite-unique.description: Add composite unique constraint to a table.

x-foreign-key.description: Add a foreign key constraint to a column. Must have the format "<table name>.<column name>".

x-foreign-key-column.description: Customize the column used for the foreign key constraint of a relationship.

x-tablename.description: Define the name of a table.

x-relationship-backrefs.description: INTERNAL USE ONLY: Note on a schema that a back reference was created.

x-de-$ref.description: INTERNAL USE ONLY: Track the name of a constructed model for a property referencing an object.

x-dict-ignore.description: INTERNAL USE ONLY: Do not add to the schema record used by from_- and to_dict functions.
